definition: to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
6th earthly branch: 9-11 a.m., 4th solar month (5th May-5th June), year of the Snake/ancient Chinese compass point: 150°
in the same place/together/with/altogether (in total)

(after a verb) indicating the beginning and continuation of an action or a state/indicating an upward movement (e.g. after 站[zhan4])/indicating completion/(after a perception verb, e.g. 看[kan4]) expressing preliminary judgment/also pr. [qi3 lai5]
to stand up/to get up/also pr. [qi3 lai2]

(after a verb) indicating the beginning and continuation of an action or a state/indicating an upward movement (e.g. after 站[zhan4])/indicating completion/(after a perception verb, e.g. 看[kan4]) expressing preliminary judgment/also pr. [qi3 lai5]
to stand up/to get up/also pr. [qi3 lai2]
to give rise to/to lead to/to cause/to arouse
to sue/to bring a lawsuit against/to prosecute
to mention/to speak of/to lift/to pick up/to arouse/to raise (a topic, a heavy weight, one's fist, one's spirits etc)
to originate/to initiate/to launch (an attack, an initiative etc)/to start/to propose sth (for the first time)
seemingly/apparently/looks as if/appear to be/gives the impression that/seems on the face of it to be
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
to recall/to think of/to call to mind
to lift/to raise in height/to begin/upsurge/to set off (a campaign)
to set out/to set in motion/the start (of some activity)
starting point
(of an aircraft) to take off
at the minimum/at the very least

sentences.english: Who make you mushroom so late, the whole ruddy blood temple you this hour equitable obtain up.
sentences.chinese: 誰讓你起得這麼晚，整個赤血宮就你這個時辰才起牀。

sentences.english: The sun blistered the paint on the wall.
sentences.chinese: 在陽光下牆上的油漆起氣泡了。

sentences.english: How can I rebuild my trust in him?
sentences.chinese: 怎樣才能重新建立起我對他的信任？

sentences.english: Dr. Stevens has worked at the language institute since 1982.
sentences.chinese: 史蒂文斯從1982年起就一直在語言學院工作。

sentences.english: A white light flashed, lit the sky in silver.
sentences.chinese: 一道白光閃起，夜空亮起銀輝。

sentences.english: He is antipathetic to new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 他天生就封新觀念起反感。

sentences.english: The bird flew up from the grass.
Because of how you reacted in the morning.
sentences.chinese: 一切皆由你早上的反應而起。

sentences.english: Luo city have door and the high-rise.
sentences.chinese: 例句與用法羅城的四面修有城門，上起高樓。

sentences.english: Suddenly the hero's son picked up a knife and killed the dragon.
sentences.chinese: 突然英雄的兒子拿起刀殺了龍。

sentences.english: The sky light thin mist, cricket that month.
sentences.chinese: 天邊淺淡薄霧起，蛐蛐叫月。

sentences.english: Placebos work, doctors believed, because the mind is a powerful thing.
sentences.chinese: 醫生們相信安慰劑起作用，是因爲念力是一種力量。

sentences.english: Overseas chinese are bring into foreigners since 2000.
sentences.chinese: 從2000年起，華僑併入外國人統計。

sentences.english: He is a greto football player, from all accounts.
sentences.chinese: 外傳他是個很不了起的足球運帶動。

sentences.english: After, at together while just wanting to elected up a cosmetics to make up for farmland dream Jean Jean.
sentences.chinese: 之後，在齊珍珍剛要拿起化妝品幫田夢化妝的時候。

sentences.english: Santiago drank sparingly from his water bottle during the hot afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 在熾熱的下午，桑提亞哥節省地喝起水壺裏的水。

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
